examples: We climbed the sturdy branches of the tree to get a better view.
She climbed the greasy pole to become the CEO.
She climbed onto the roof to enjoy the view from above.
He climbs on the bandwagon when he joins a new popular cause.
The truck's engine roared as it climbed the steep hill.
words.defineEn: to increase in terms of amount, value, intensity, etc.
words.defineVi: để tăng về số lượng, giá trị, cường độ, vv

words.defineEn: to increase in value, extent, amount, etc.
words.defineVi: để tăng giá trị, mức độ, số lượng, vv

examples: Sales are growing fast.
The market is growing rapidly.
The company is healthily growing its revenue each year.
By degrees their business relationship grew into friendship.
The sector is growing at a phenomenal rate.
words.defineEn: to become greater in size, amount, number, or quality
words.defineVi: trở nên lớn hơn về kích thước, số lượng, số lượng hoặc chất lượng

examples: The increase had a ripple effect through the whole financial market.
The tax increase sounded the death knell for the business.
The report showed an increase in sales.
The company's new product line contributed to a significant increase in its overall yield for the quarter.
The company's new product launch led to a fat increase in revenue.
words.defineEn: to become larger in amount or size
words.defineVi: để trở nên lớn hơn về số lượng hoặc kích thước

examples: The car ahead of me jumped the light.
The child jumped up and down with excitement.
My cat jumped onto the kitchen counter.
He jumped the queue at the ticket counter.
The squirrel jumped from one tree branch to another.
words.defineEn: (particularly of a price, rate, etc.) to increase sharply
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là giá cả, tỷ lệ, v.v.) tăng mạnh

examples: The company rose like a rocket by trading sub-prime mortgages, and then fell like a stick when the housing bubble burst.
Everyone has their eyes on the young actress who has been rising like a rocket in the film industry.
Designing a website may be a lot of work but it’s not rocket science.
I love rockets.
Rockets struck at a military base outside Irbil.
words.defineEn: (of a price, amount, etc.) to increase suddenly and significantly
words.defineVi: (của một mức giá, số lượng, v.v.) tăng đột ngột và đáng kể

examples: The government's popularity is declining, as the polls show.
The company's profits have been declining for months, but the CEO only started to take notice after the stock price dropped significantly.
For the past couple of years, the chattering classes have argued about whether the religious right is in decline.
The company's profits began to decline, and the business eventually ground to a halt.
They soon realized that riches have wings, and their profits declined.
words.defineEn: to reduce in amount, size, intensity, etc.
words.defineVi: để giảm số lượng, kích thước, cường độ, vv

examples: At last the wind dropped.
Her eyes dropped to her lap.
I dropped another plate!
His voice dropped to a whisper.
The spoon dropped with a clatter from her hand.
words.defineEn: to reduce or make something reduced in amount, number, degree, or intensity
words.defineVi: để giảm hoặc làm cho một cái gì đó giảm về số lượng, số lượng, mức độ, hoặc cường độ

examples: Shergar film falls at the first fence in Cannes.
Underneath the orange tree, the leaves gently fall.
The fall knocked the wind out of me.
The leaves fall from the trees in autumn.
People are falling like flies from COVID-19.
words.defineEn: to decrease in quantity, quality, or extent
words.defineVi: để giảm số lượng, chất lượng, hoặc mức độ

words.defineEn: to go to a lower place
words.defineVi: đi đến một nơi thấp hơn

examples: Oysters' market value, and restaurant orders, plummeted.
The number of prosecutions and convictions have plummeted.
The value of the Iranian currency has plummeted.
Trump's approval ratings were plummeting.
After a year, though, sales for the Dreamcast plummeted.
words.defineEn: to decline in amount or value in a sudden and rapid way
words.defineVi: giảm về số lượng hoặc giá trị một cách đột ngột và nhanh chóng

examples: The company has plunged $37 million into the red.
We took the plunge and set up our own business.
The bridge collapsed, and the car plunged under.
Emma and Michael had been in a committed relationship for a long time, so they finally took the plunge and exchanged wedding vows.
If you have been thinking about buying shares, now could be the time to take the plunge.
words.defineEn: to suddenly move or cause someone or something move downward, forward, or into something
words.defineVi: đột nhiên di chuyển hoặc khiến ai đó hoặc cái gì đó di chuyển xuống dưới, về phía trước hoặc vào một cái gì đó

examples: With a balanced diet, regular exercise, and a positive mindset, Alex maintains being up to the mark in terms of his overall well-being.
The tobacco products included a humectant to maintain the moisture content and freshness.
Maintaining a low profile has never been Maggie's strongest suit.
The document must be copied word for word to maintain its legal validity.
Consuming milk can help maintain healthy skin due to the presence of vitamin A.
words.defineEn: to make something stay in the same state or condition
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó ở trong cùng một trạng thái hoặc điều kiện

examples: The popularity of electric vehicles has remained in the ascendant.
A slight question mark against her character remains.
The question of the descent remained on his mind throughout 1598.
The incident has remained something of an elephant in the room within our family.
After numerous inspections, the correct answer to this dilemma still remains at sea.
words.defineEn: to stay in the same state or condition
words.defineVi: để ở trong cùng một trạng thái hoặc điều kiện

examples: The store stays open late on Thursdays.
The TV stays on all day in their house.
Stay in touch with your customers via Internet.
Stay in touch with the latest technologies.
Enjoy your stay at our hotel.
words.defineEn: to keep being in the same state or situation
words.defineVi: để giữ được trong cùng một trạng thái hoặc tình hình

examples: The constant noise from the construction site vexed the residents of the neighborhood.
The baby’s constant crying drove me to distraction.
Your constant tapping is driving me up the wall!
Her constant criticism really makes my hackles rise!
His constant invasion of her privacy was driving her to distraction.
words.defineEn: being the same and not changing by the passage of time
words.defineVi: giống nhau và không thay đổi theo thời gian

examples: A stable relationship stands the test of time.
If you try to replace the oil filter on the engine now, you're just closing the stable door after the horse has bolted.
John was nervous about quitting his stable job to start his own business, but he knew that no guts, no glory, and he took the leap.

When Tom was offered a high-risk investment opportunity with the potential for a big payout, he remembered the saying better a steady dime than a rare dollar and decided to invest his money in a more stable option.
She led the horse back into the stable.
words.defineEn: firm and able to stay in the same position or state
words.defineVi: công ty và có thể ở cùng một vị trí hoặc trạng thái

examples: The stock portfolio showed a steady yield, generating consistent profits for the shareholders.
The cars run along the highway in a steady stream.
By this time next year, we will have made significant headway on our goals, thanks to our steady progress and hard work.

When Tom was offered a high-risk investment opportunity with the potential for a big payout, he remembered the saying better a steady dime than a rare dollar and decided to invest his money in a more stable option.
In trading today the dollar held steady against the yen.
words.defineEn: describing something that is reliable and constant for a long period of time
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó là đáng tin cậy và liên tục trong một thời gian dài

examples: For the time being, our plans remain unchanged until something convinces us otherwise.
So, my opinion remains unchanged.
That's unchanged.
It is basically unchanged.
Where the mask blocks the light, the photoresist is unchanged.
words.defineEn: subject to no change and staying in the same state
words.defineVi: không thay đổi và giữ nguyên trạng thái

examples: In front of them the valley dropped sharply away from the road.
She turned the wheel sharply to the left.
The road bends sharply to the left just ahead, so be prepared to slow down.
NASDAQ is down sharply again and its European counterparts are still in the doldrums.
Stockholders took it on the chin yesterday as markets fell sharply.
words.defineEn: with a sudden and rapid change of direction
words.defineVi: với sự thay đổi hướng đột ngột và nhanh chóng

examples: The market is growing rapidly.
The company is gaining ground rapidly with its new product launch.
The helicopter blades spun rapidly as it prepared for takeoff.
Peter was losing hair rapidly.
Ever since George hit his forties, his hairline has been receding rapidly.
words.defineEn: at a fast rate; in a way that is very quick
words.defineVi: với tốc độ nhanh; một cách rất nhanh chóng

examples: The time passed quickly.
The cruise went very quickly.
The eggs cook quickly in a hot frying pan.
The worm turns quickly in the world of politics.
The new student quickly made friends with the other musicians, because birds of a feather flock together.
words.defineEn: with a lot of speed
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều tốc độ

examples: The land dropped steeply away into a small valley.
If you've ever driven on a curved freeway overpass, you sometimes notice that the road is steeply banked to the side.
To combat climate change, we need to steeply reduce fossil fuel emissions, and draw down excess CO2 to restore our atmosphere’s balance of greenhouse gases.
Or why in cold snowy places like Siberia, houses have steeply pitched roofs.

A prudent plan B, because older Gen Z'ers, like those in our unscientific sample at least, are economically hard-nosed, and shooting for the top tier in an economy they have seen become more steeply split their entire lives.
words.defineEn: rising or falling with a large angle
words.defineVi: tăng hoặc giảm với một góc lớn

examples: The government has loosened its hold on the media considerably.
The temperature has dropped considerably.
First, internal combustion engines have improved considerably.
As a reaction to this international criticism, things have improved considerably.
So the harmful effects, if any, vary considerably from person to person.
words.defineEn: a lot; by a significant amount or to a significant extent
words.defineVi: nhiều; bởi một số lượng đáng kể hoặc đến một mức độ đáng kể

examples: The company's stock prices took a beating in the market, dropping significantly due to poor financial performance.
The company's profits have been declining for months, but the CEO only started to take notice after the stock price dropped significantly.
The oil industry pollutes, significantly.
White Castle's profits fell significantly.
There, phonons could significantly affect the star’s behavior.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is important or large enough to be noticed or be effective
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là quan trọng hoặc đủ lớn để được chú ý hoặc có hiệu quả

examples: Its stock price has fallen substantially over the last couple of months.
Oh, they would benefit very substantially.
And they must contribute substantially to military protection from now on.
So it's substantially better at its job in infecting people.
So it's substantially better at its job in infecting people.
words.defineEn: to a considerable extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ đáng kể hoặc mức độ

examples: During her speech, she projected her voice clearly and steadily, showing that she had a healthy pair of lungs.
The writing is on the wall and the warnings steadily become more obvious.
Changes began during Japan's doldrums when the government tried to revive growth by steadily deregulating sections of the economy.
Bucket seats steadily became more popular.
Humanity’s energy consumption is rising steadily.
words.defineEn: in a gradual and even way
words.defineVi: một cách dần dần và thậm chí

examples: During February, the days gradually start getting longer as we move closer to spring.
After the CEO announced that she had been diagnosed with dementia, her daughter gradually began taking the reins of the company.
He used to be an important member of the team, but he's gradually drifted out of the picture.
The tension and excitement built gradually all day.
The sky gradually brightened as the morning sun rose.
words.defineEn: slowly and in small amounts over a long period of time; not suddenly
words.defineVi: chậm và với số lượng nhỏ trong một thời gian dài; không đột ngột

examples: And a couple of weeks after that first shot, you were moderately well-protected.
And a couple of weeks after that first shot, you were moderately well-protected.
Financial planners might refer to this as a moderately conservative investment.
You can be mildly to moderately to severely depressed.
Moderately comfortable they're like stiff.
words.defineEn: to an average extent or degree; quite
words.defineVi: ở mức độ hoặc mức độ trung bình; khá

examples: That said, house prices rose slightly last month.
Emmental's creamy texture and slightly sweet taste make it a crowd-pleaser.
The car manufacturer's latest model outperformed its competitors by a nose, offering slightly better fuel efficiency and a more comfortable ride.
Gouda has a mild and slightly nutty flavor.
He came out of basic training only slightly the worse for wear.
words.defineEn: a little and not very much
words.defineVi: một chút và không nhiều lắm

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The blades of the helicopter were turning slowly.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
He slowly raised his head up.
words.defineEn: moving or doing something at a slow speed; not quickly
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc làm điều gì đó với tốc độ chậm; không nhanh chóng
